intro: Croton petenensis, commonly known as the Petén croton, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage, which can range from bright yellow to deep red. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
